posts.post_content: A card that neutralizes a sizable portion of all cards is bad design, especially when it's gonna take her 10 turns to seal the deal. [Novablast Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Novablast Wurm) can be brutal, but at least it costs 3GGWW *and* ends the game in 3 turns; Blinding Angel, on the other hand, keeps the losing player helpless and bored for a long time.
posts.html:
A card that neutralizes a sizable portion of all cards is bad design, especially when it's gonna take her 10 turns to seal the deal. Novablast Wurm can be brutal, but at least it costs 3GGWW and ends the game in 3 turns; Blinding Angel, on the other hand, keeps the losing player helpless and bored for a long time.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Gabriel422 (1/21/2011 1:57:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I had a U-W control deck that LOVED Blinding Angel. It was great fun to not have to even worry about countering most of the things your opponent played anymore because you had one permanent that neutralised most of their spells.
  
Oh, and that permanent/answer card also would eventually give you the damage that you need to kill your opponent!
posts.html:
I had a U-W control deck that LOVED Blinding Angel. It was great fun to not have to even worry about countering most of the things your opponent played anymore because you had one permanent that neutralised most of their spells.
Oh, and that permanent/answer card also would eventually give you the damage that you need to kill your opponent!

Posted By: RxPhantom (7/20/2011 9:18:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Gabriel422: It doesn't neutralize all that much. All you need to do is block her. You know, with one of those creatures that you weren't able to attack with. She only has 2 power, and no evasion beyond flying-- Shouldn't be too hard. Or use some sort of damage prevention effect, again it's only 2 points. Or (it must be said, though it's true of almost everything) some sort of removal. You can combo this with [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) or the like, but that just says that the combo is powerful, and there are plenty of card combos that'll just win the game outright (besides, Whispersilk combos well with *everything* worthwhile). It's a powerful effect, but it's fairly balanced by being easy to guard against.
posts.html:
@Gabriel422: It doesn't neutralize all that much. All you need to do is block her. You know, with one of those creatures that you weren't able to attack with. She only has 2 power, and no evasion beyond flying-- Shouldn't be too hard. Or use some sort of damage prevention effect, again it's only 2 points. Or (it must be said, though it's true of almost everything) some sort of removal. You can combo this with Whispersilk Cloak or the like, but that just says that the combo is powerful, and there are plenty of card combos that'll just win the game outright (besides, Whispersilk combos well with everything worthwhile). It's a powerful effect, but it's fairly balanced by being easy to guard against.
